section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Dangerous Goods (Consignment by Air) (Safety) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Cargo
def.leadIn: cargo (貨物) means any article carried on an aircraft other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mail; and (L.N. 141 of 2011)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accompanied or mishandled baggage; (L.N. 193 of 2007)

section.def: consignor (托運人) means a person who consigns dangerous goods for carriage by air;
declared dangerous goods (已申報危險品) means dangerous goods accompanied by the documents required by regulation 6(1); (L.N. 75 of 2006)
freight forwarder (貨運代理人) means a person who offers the service of arranging the carriage of goods by air; (L.N. 75 of 2006)
mail (郵件) means letters and other articles delivered, or intended to be delivered, by postal services in accordance with the rules of the Universal Postal Union; (L.N. 193 of 2007)
operator (經營人) means the operator of an aircraft;
shipper (付運人) means a person, other than a freight forwarder, who offers dangerous goods for carriage by air;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: whether or not sold, are intended for consumption by the passengers and the crew on board an aircraft; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: are necessary for the operation and maintenance of an aircraft; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: goods for sale to the passengers and the crew on board an aircraft which are intended to be landed from the aircraft; (L.N. 193 of 2007)

section.def: Technical Instructions (技術指令) means the edition of the Technical Instructions specified in Part 1 of the Schedule.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Meaning of consign, etc.
section.leadIn: For the purposes of these regulations a person consigns dangerous goods for carriage by air if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: being a shipper, he offers the goods to an operator or freight forwarder; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being a freight forwarder, he offers the goods to an operator or to another freight forwarder,

section.name: s4
section.heading: Dangerous goods to comply with Technical Instructions

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (2), no dangerous goods shall be consigned for carriage by air unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the goods are of a category which is not prohibited to be carried by air by the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this sub-paragraph in Part 2 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the goods are classified and packed in accordance with the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this sub-paragraph in Part 2 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the packagings used are in accordance with such of the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this sub-paragraph in Part 2 of the Schedule as apply to the goods;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any package containing the dangerous goods is marked and labelled in accordance with the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this sub-paragraph in Part 2 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this sub-paragraph in Part 2 of the Schedule are complied with in respect of any dangerous goods, package or packaging;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any package containing the dangerous goods is in a fit condition for carriage by air; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the goods are declared dangerous goods. (L.N. 75 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (1) shall not apply to dangerous goods—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consigned for carriage by air on any aircraft belonging to or exclusively employed in the service of the Government or on the naval, military or air force aircraft of any country; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of a type described in the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this sub-paragraph in Part 2 of the Schedule, to the extent and in the circumstances described in those provisions.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4), where paragraph (1) is contravened—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any consignor of the goods; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the contravention relates to any act or function performed by another person for or on behalf of any consignor, that person,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be convicted of an offence under paragraph (3) if he satisfies the court or magistrate that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act or omission constituting the contravention occurred without his knowledge or consent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he could not, by the exercise of reasonable supervision and reasonable diligence, have prevented the occurrence of that act or omission.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Packaging to comply with Technical Instructions

subsection.content: No person shall label, mark, certify or offer any packaging as meeting the requirements of the Technical Instructions unless the packaging is made, marked, labelled, maintained, reconditioned or repaired in accordance with the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this paragraph in Part 2 of the Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes paragraph (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $250,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of these regulations the documents to be completed in respect of dangerous goods are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an air waybill; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a dangerous goods transport document, except that such a document shall not be required in respect of such categories of dangerous goods as may be specified in the Technical Instructions as being goods in respect of which a dangerous goods transport document is not required.

subsection.leadIn: An air waybill required by paragraph (1)(a) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refer to the particular dangerous goods transport document completed in respect of the dangerous goods; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify where appropriate that the dangerous goods are of a category or in a quantity required by the Technical Instructions to be loaded in and carried in a cargo aircraft only.

subsection.leadIn: A dangerous goods transport document required by paragraph (1)(b) shall be completed by the shipper and shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: classify and describe the dangerous goods in accordance with the requirements of the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this sub-paragraph in Part 2 of the Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain a certification signed by or on behalf of the shipper in the terms set out in the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this sub-paragraph in Part 2 of the Schedule. (L.N. 141 of 2011)

subsection.content: A copy of the air waybill and dangerous goods transport document in respect of any dangerous goods shall be retained by the consignor of the goods, or by each consignor if there are more than one, for a period of not less than 6 months commencing on the date on which the goods are first consigned.
A consignor who without reasonable excuse contravenes paragraph (4) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Person signing transport document to be trained

subsection.leadIn: No person shall sign a certification referred to in regulation 6(3)(b) in a dangerous goods transport document unless he has completed training programmes which— (L.N. 141 of 2011)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are appropriate to his functions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are described in the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this subparagraph in Part 2 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: have been approved by the Director; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: are delivered by instructors who satisfy the requirements set out in the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this subparagraph in Part 2 of the Schedule. (L.N. 193 of 2007)

subsection.content: Where paragraph (1) is contravened the shipper completing the document and any person signing the certification on behalf of the shipper each commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 141 of 2011)

section.name: s7A
section.heading: Training requirements for staff members of freight forwarders processing cargo containing declared dangerous goods

subsection.leadIn: A member of the staff of a freight forwarder shall not perform the function of processing cargo containing declared dangerous goods unless he has completed training programmes which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are appropriate to his functions;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: have been approved by the Director; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: are delivered by instructors who satisfy the requirements set out in the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this subparagraph in Part 2 of the Schedule. (L.N. 193 of 2007)

subsection.content: Where paragraph (1) is contravened the freight forwarder and the staff member each commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s7B
section.heading: Other training requirements for staff members of freight forwarders

subsection.leadIn: A freight forwarder shall ensure that each member of his staff who performs the function of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: processing cargo, mail or stores not containing declared dangerous goods; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: handling, loading or storing cargo, mail or stores,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: are appropriate to his functions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: are described in the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this subparagraph in Part 2 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: have been approved by the Director; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: are delivered by instructors who satisfy the requirements set out in the provisions of the Technical Instructions specified for the purposes of this subparagraph in Part 2 of the Schedule. (L.N. 194 of 2007)

subsection.content: A freight forwarder who fails to comply with paragraph (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

The Chief Executive may, by order published in the Gazette, exempt any person, dangerous goods or packaging, or any class or category of persons, dangerous goods or packaging from the application of these regulations or any part thereof and either absolutely or upon such conditions as are specified in the order. (Amended 36 of 1999 s. 3)

The Director may, in any case where it appears to him to be necessary or desirable in the public interest to do so, and if he is satisfied that adequate alternative safety measures have been or will be taken in the circumstances, in writing exempt any person, dangerous goods or packaging from the application of these regulations or any part thereof and either absolutely or upon such conditions as he may specify.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule
section.content: The Director may, by order published in the Gazette, amend the Schedule.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to Dangerous Goods (Consignment by Air) (Safety) (Amendment) Regulation 2021

subsection.content: This regulation applies during the period beginning on 2 July 2021 and ending on 31 December 2022.

For the purposes of regulations 7(1)(b), 7A(1)(b) and 7B(1)(d), a training programme described in Chapter 4.2 of Part 1 of the former edition is taken to be a training programme described in Chapters 4.1, 4.2, 4.3 and 4.4 of Part 1 of the new edition.

For the purposes of regulations 7(1)(d), 7A(1)(d) and 7B(1)(f), an instructor who satisfies the requirements set out in Chapter 4.3 of Part 1 of the former edition is taken to be an instructor who satisfies the requirements set out in Chapter 4.6 of Part 1 of the new edition.

subsection.def: former edition (原有版本) means the 2019–2020 Edition of the Technical Instructions as defined by section 2 of the Ordinance;
new edition (新版本) means the 2021–2022 Edition of the Technical Instructions as defined by section 2 of the Ordinance.
